com.github.cjengineer18.desktopwindowtemplate.util.factory

Class StandardMenuFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.cjengineer18.desktopwindowtemplate.util.factory.StandardMenuFactory

  • public class StandardMenuFactory
extends Object
    Factory for menus, either for a menu bar or for a sub-menu.
    Author:
    Cristian Jimenez

    • Method Detail

      • createMenu

        public static JMenu createMenu(String label,
                               ActionListener listener,
                               Object... content)
                        throws InvalidParameterException
        Create a menu ready to use in a menu bar or in a sub-menu. This menu will share the same listener for all options, whose functions will be defined by listener.
        Parameters:
        label - The menu's name.
        listener - The object that will listen to the menu items.
        content - The items to add.
        Returns:
        A JMenu with all the items added and with the listener implemented.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - In case any of the parameters is null.

      • createMenu

        public static JMenu createMenu(String label,
                               ActionListener listener,
                               Object[] content,
                               String[] commands)
                        throws InvalidParameterException
        Create a menu ready to use in a menu bar or in a sub-menu. This menu will share the same listener for all the options, whose functions will be defined by listener and that will receive the commands defined in commands. You should be aware that if there is a submenu or a separator in content [i], then the value in commands [i] must be null.
        Parameters:
        label - The menu's name.
        listener - The object that will listen to the menu items.
        content - The items to add.
        commands - The available commands.
        Returns:
        A JMenu with all the items added and with the listener and commands implemented.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - In case any of the parameters are null, not valid or content.length != commands.length.
        See Also:
        createMenu(String, ActionListener, Object...), SEPARATOR

      • createMenu

        public static JMenu createMenu(String label,
                               ActionListener[] listeners,
                               String[] content)
                        throws InvalidParameterException
        Create a menu ready to use in a menu bar or in a sub-menu. Each option of the menu will have its own listener, so that each option performs a different function.
        Parameters:
        label - The menu's name.
        listeners - An array with all the listeners available.
        content - The items to add.
        Returns:
        A JMenu with all the items added and with the listener implemented.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - In case one of the parameters is null or that listeners.length != content.length.
